pull_request.title: Split step to install dependencies from source into its own tutorial

pullrequest.title: Split step to install dependencies from source into its own tutorial

content.raw: I think they're all consolidated in a way in the original tutorial. This tutorial was an effort to have a reference in case people want to build the packages separately. Maybe this wasn't clear though... I think ideally each package would have their own tutorial series like how ignition transport does.
content.html: I think they're all consolidated in a way in the original tutorial. This tutorial was an effort to have a reference in case people want to build the packages separately. Maybe this wasn't clear though... I think ideally each package would have their own tutorial series like how ignition transport does.

content.raw:
although it looks good, I find that this snippet doesn't cut and paste well in my terminal. Also, and this is a detail, I think that his one is better (because... docker)

`apt install -y sudo wget lsb-release mesa-utils build-essential cmake mercurial`
content.html:
although it looks good, I find that this snippet doesn't cut and paste well in my terminal. Also, and this is a detail, I think that his one is better (because... docker)

apt install -y sudo wget lsb-release mesa-utils build-essential cmake mercurial

pull_request.title: Split step to install dependencies from source into its own tutorial

pullrequest.title: Split step to install dependencies from source into its own tutorial

content.raw: Adding the new section for install from source the dependencies conflicts somehow with the previous section of Prerequisites that runs `ROS_DISTRO=dummy . /tmp/dependencies.sh` and it's now mandatory. We first install packages and after install code from source which can lead to a good mess in the filesystem. Two solutions, we made both options alternative or we uninstall packages in the install_from_source tutorial.
content.html: Adding the new section for install from source the dependencies conflicts somehow with the previous section of Prerequisites that runs ROS_DISTRO=dummy . /tmp/dependencies.sh and it's now mandatory. We first install packages and after install code from source which can lead to a good mess in the filesystem. Two solutions, we made both options alternative or we uninstall packages in the install_from_source tutorial.

pull_request.title: Split step to install dependencies from source into its own tutorial

pullrequest.title: Split step to install dependencies from source into its own tutorial

content.raw: Let me take advantage of this PR to push this section of ROS Users to have another level of indention so it falls under Prerequisites. While reviewing the tutorial I found confused to find `ROS Users` and `Install Required Dependencies` at the same level and even looked to me that `Install Required Dependencies` falls under `ROS Users`.
content.html: Let me take advantage of this PR to push this section of ROS Users to have another level of indention so it falls under Prerequisites. While reviewing the tutorial I found confused to find ROS Users and Install Required Dependencies at the same level and even looked to me that Install Required Dependencies falls under ROS Users.
